choices: you are abducted as a seven year old
you were abducted as a seven year old and have grown up
you are abducted as a teenager
you are abducted as an adult
your parents were abducted and you were born a gladiator
1.content: The arena world called pyros is made of three main parts, the planet’s surface is wild like a jungle with plants from throught the universe and some from earth but the conditions are terrestrial and so survival is possible and is treated as a communal area in which gladiators live and harvest natural supplies such as wood and rocks, the orbiting space stations above the surface holds the numerous arenas and is the second part the third part is the lockers, boxes the size of a small room, one for each gladiator in which he can store his weapons and food and perhaps sleep in the if they so choose, finally on the north and south poles of the planet where there can be no life at those temperatures lies fortified towers that control the teleportation of the gladiators between the three areas. what age are you when you are abducted?
1.title: the new guy

11.content: Are you male or female? And are you competent or incompetent as a gladiator?
11.title: you are abducted as a sven year old

choices: Another new young gladiator - a girl your age, with the same equipment as you.
A young gladiator a couple years older than you. He looks tough and has a spear.
A wild boar, taken from earth. Its tusks look sharp.
113.content: You are a seven year old boy abducted to fight in the arena for the entertainment of aliens. You are small, weak and slow, with no experience in fighting or surviving. Unless you are smart, you will probably die a lot. At least if you do die, you will be reborn as your brain is cloned, although dying still promises pain and humiliation. Consistently poor gladiators will eventually stop being reborn for being too useless, leading to permanent death. For your first fight, you are going to be given a fairly easy fight to evaluate your capabilities and ease you into your new life. You are made to wear only a loincloth and are given no armour, although you are at least given a small knife so that you have some means of defending yourself. The arena master tells you this will be the only time you are given such a privilege, however. The pit master gives you three choices to take for your first fight. None of them look TOO threatening, although each seems to promise a pretty tough fight.
113.title: male and incompetent

choices: Raise your knife up high and charge her
Stand your ground - wait for her to attack
Observe your surroundings and see if you can get an advantage
1131.content: You decide to go with the young girl. As you are both equipped the same and both lack experience in fighting, you decide it would be the easiest fight of the three choices. You recognise her vaguely - she was probably abducted at the same time as you. The arena master nods at your choice, and sends both of you to the gates on opposite sides of the arena. As this is a new pair fighting, you have been put into a smaller side arena rather than the large, main arena where well known gladiators fight. As you walk towards the gate, you can hear the crowd cheering in anticipation of the bloodshed. You know that people will be watching. You become a little embarrassed - you hope that you aren't overpowered by a young girl in front of thousands of people. You can see her through the gate on the other side of the arena. You don't have time to notice much other than her small size and lack of armour - much like you - before the announcer booms the pre-match commentary. It is in a strange, alien language, and you don't understand, although you realise the announcer is hyping the fight, explaining who is taking part and trying to get people to bet. After a minute of his talking, the gate in front of you crashes open, and you are pushed into the arena by a forcefield. The girl stands looking at you, trying to find a weakness. What do you do?
1131.title: Another new young gladiator - a girl your age.

11311.content: You raise the small metal knife above your head, lead out a cry and charge forward. The girl adopts a defensive pose, ready to dodge out of the way or block your attack. You are nearly upon her. How do you attack?
11311.title: Aggressive Fighting

choices: Swing your knife as soon as you are in range
Barge into her and swing the knife down
113111.content: You keep running straight at her - how do you plan to attack her?
113111.title: Keep charging

choices: Defend - wait for her to attack you
1131111.content: You charge at the girl, as she tenses herself and prepares to counter attack. As soon as you are in range, you suddenly stop and swing your knife. The girl is caught off guard by your sudden change in momentum, and you manage to cut her arm. She gasps in pain, and takes a step back, preparing to fight you. How do you fight?
1131111.title: Swing your knife as soon as you are in range

choices: Launch another attack - teach her not to hurt you!
11311111.content: Seeing her on the defensive and injured, you continue pushing the attack, and make a wide swing towards her. However, it is a poor, slow attack and he easily dodges, jabbing the knife into your side before pulling it out. The wound hurts, but luckily it is a minor injury. You will still be even less effective now though.
11311111.title: Injured!

113111111.content: You angrily swing your knife at her again. However, once again the attack is slow and weak, and she easily steps aside, grabbing your arm and twisting it, forcing you to drop the knife. The girl has your arm twisted painfully and you are unarmed.
113111111.title: Launch another attack - teach her not to hurt you!

choices: You wake up in a strange room...
1131111111.content: Furious, you try to swing your free arm at her. She is surprised for a moment, and you manage to hit her lightly on the chin. However, this just seems to anger her, and she quickly knees you in the face and releases your arm, before stabbing you in the stomach before you can react. The pain is sharp and you fall to the ground, clutching your bleeding abdomen. As you lie there, the girl slits your throat and ends your suffering. Despite your defeat, you hear the cloud cheering as your vision goes dark. You might have been an easy kill, but your aggressive nature made for an exciting show!
1131111111.title: An entertaining fight

choices: You wake up in a strange room...
1131112.content: You keep running straight at the girl - she doesn't flinch, and her eyes stare straight at you. As you prepare to bring your weapon down, she springs like a snake, jabbing her knife straight at you. It pierces your unclothed chest and goes straight into your heart. Blood starts pouring from the wound, although you are dead before you can feel anything, and your corpse drops to the ground face first as the girl removes the dagger. The crowd applauses politely, although they are disappointed in your poor performance. The girl, although frightened, bows and walks out of the arena, taking your knife with her. That is the last thing you remember until you are reborn - just like that, you have lost your first fight.
1131112.title: Poor Strategy

choices: Follow the alien through the door
11311121.content:
You slowly open your eyes - there is a bright light, and you can't see for a moment. As your eyes adjust, you see you are in a clean white room, like a doctors office. There are strange alien machines marked with odd runes from the aliens' language. You try to move your arm, but you can't; it seems to be strapped to the chair you are sat in, as are your legs. You look down and realise the precarious situation you are in. You are completely naked, and are strapped to a large chair, like what you might find at a dentists. Your arms and legs are shackled to the chair, and you can't move them an inch. You wonder where you are - is this hell? You clearly remember getting stabbed in the chest, yet your chest feels fine and you can't see any signs of injury or surgery. Before you can ponder too much though, an alien enters from the door behind you. You can't get a good look at him, but he is bipedal and large bodied. He is wearing a metal outfit around him, leaving only his head exposed. He has grey, wrinkled flesh and two black eyes. His mouth must be inside his outfit, because you can't make it out.

"Oh, you are awake." The creature notes in an accented voice. "At least you can be reborn properly."

You can't respond, as you feel terrified and confused in equal measure.

"Don't worry. I shan't hurt you. After all, why would I have revived you if that were the case?" The creature asks, chuckling to himself. "I suppose I should explain what is going on. You are a slave to us. We don't expect you to work - rather to fight in our arena, as I'm sure you are aware. Your first fight was rather pathetic, though. I hardly wanted to rebirth you. How does that work, I suppose you wonder? Well, we clone your brain straight from your corpse, and use your DNA to create a new body. You are exactly the same as you were when you died, physically at least. Anyhow, I shall let you go. I doubt much was explained to you before your fight. Sorry about that, but one of our champions didn't show up so we had to arrange your fight quickly. Come, walk with me, I shall explain your situation."

With that, your shackles unbuckle, and the alien leaves the room, humming a strange song. You look around, and finding nothing you can take, decide to follow him.
11311121.title: Reborn

113111211.content:
The alien leads you down a well-lit corridor. The walls are metal and clean, and electric lights leave the corridor well lit. You are still naked, and feel embarrassed as you walk past several other aliens, as well as the odd human, although barely anybody cares enough to look at you.

"This is the rebirth station. When you die, if we choose to, we can recreate you exactly the way you were when you died. This is what happened to you. After all, abducting humans is dangerous and expensive. If we get seen, we are in huge trouble, so we have to do it carefully. We can't take too many at once either - if a bunch of people go missing, people would get suspicious. We brainwash you as soon as you are aboard - nothing too much, otherwise your brain would get fried, but just enough that you don't worry about going back, and that you accept us as your leaders."

You turn a corner, and one of the walls is decorated by large, floor to ceiling windows. Through them, you can see a huge city, the most predominant building being a large oval structure that you think must be a stadium - probably the arena.

"Some of you can be put to work, but most get brought here to amuse us. We enjoy watching you tear each other to pieces. You are a barbaric race, but you come up with fantastic ways of killing. Very entertaining. And so you fight for us. You die for us. And then you are reborn, if we choose it. This time we did choose it, but if you are a disappointment..."

The creature shrugs.

"Why would we bring you back? No fun in watching someone pathetic. Usually we just execute you - have you butchered in the most brutal ways imaginable - and leave you dead forever. Anyway, you lost your first fight, and with it, your only equipment. We don't give out freebies. You want something, you have to take it. Ah, that reminds me. You never got to see the planet before your fight did you? You see, this structure is not where you will live. It is where WE live. When you are not wanted to fight, we leave you to roam on a wilderness planet. There are no shops, so you have to find or make things yourself. Sometimes we leave loot lying around to spice things up. There are safe zones that we patrol and keep clear of wild beasts. Yes, you heard me. You have to survive down there. Its televised of course. Sometimes watching a human die spontaneously is great fun. But anyway, there are safe zones where you cannot be harmed by the wilderness or other humans, but don't expect to find much there."

The alien stops in front of a row of glass tubes. "

These are teleporters. They move you around the planet and our fine city. I shall give you a choice now... you can go to the planet, and try to survive until we need you, or go to the arena and see if there are any fights available. Of course, you will be summoned to fight eventually anyway. The choice is yours."
113111211.title: A guide to your new life.

1131112112.content:
You tell the alien you wish to go to the arena, and he complies, sending you there. You arrive in another glass tube, and step out. You see a larger alien in metal armour bossing another young boy around. This one is tall and imposing, with green, scaly skin and a lizard-looking head. The boy is probably in the same situation as you, as he is naked and unarmed too. As you approach, the alien sends the boy off to the locker room.

"Ah, another one." The alien remarks. "Do you want something of an explanation, or do you just want to go straight to the locker room?"
1131112112.title: Arena visit

11311121121.content:
You ask the lizard alien for an explanation.

"Well, human, I'm sure you are aware of your purpose here. But I doubt you know how it works. I shall explain."

The creature beckons for you to follow him, and he leads you to a bank of windows. You see a great arena, the size of a small town, surrounded by thousands of seats.

"This is the great arena. There are smaller ones as well. As you know, humans fight and die in them for our entertainment. We group you by age and capability, so unless we want a bloodbath, you should stand a chance. As for you, your pathetic performance in your last fight means you are the lowest of the low. Lose a couple more times, and you will find yourself in that great arena being executed in a horrible way to entertain us. So my advice is don't lose a couple more times."

The creature takes a minute to laugh at his own joke, before continuing.

"You will fight in the lowest arena. There are several arena ranks, and each arena adds something new and more exciting. Your fights will be harder, but you cannot be permanently left dead unless you are in the lowest few ranks. Its far too expensive to kill seasoned, capable warriors off for good. You will never be given weapons, clothes, armour or food. You must take them from your dead opponents, or find them on the surface. You will find safe places to sleep on the surface, and you humans tend to stick together down there. You must still be careful though. We televise the surface for a reason. When you are wanted for a fight, a ship will come and collect you as soon as you are available."

He leads you to a door.

"This will lead you to a locker room in the lowest arena. Prepare yourself, and go to the gate when we call you. You will be fighting that boy I was talking to, You are both unarmed and unclothed, so it will be an even fight. Because you both fought pathetically in your first fights, the loser of this fight will be executed. That should encourage you! Now get out there and put up a good fight!"
11311121121.title: Explanation

113111211211.content: You take a look around the locker room. As is befitting for the lower arena, it is dirty and small. There are no lockers, so it probably doesn't even classify as a locker room. There is a bench with hooks for getting changed - not that you have anything to get changed in or out of - and a shower that, after a brief test, you realise doesn't work. You prepare yourself, but you are scared. You will fight another human in front of hundreds, if not thousands of aliens laughing and cheering at you. If you lose, certain death, and not in a nice way, awaits you! Before you can put much thought into it, a voice booms from some unseen corner, telling you to progress to the gate. You walk towards to exit, noticing the blood pouring down the walkway, and take your place by the gate. A voice booms an introduction in the alien tongue, and the gate crashes open, a forcefield pushing you forwards into the arena with your opponent.
113111211211.title: Locker room

choices: Hold your ground and wait for him to make a move
1131112112111.content: The boy opposite you looks older than you, maybe about 10, but small for his age. He seems terrified, and you can see why he lost. Not that you are much better. How do you progress?
1131112112111.title: The fight

11311121121112.content: Unarmed, you charge the boy. You don't mean to, but you can't help but notice his features. He is skinny - you can see his ribs through his skin, and his limbs are narrow and spindly up to the joints - with short, messy black hair. You doubt that information will help you. You are nearly upon him, how do you attack?
11311121121112.title: Attack him

choices: Use your legs to kick him off
113111211211122.content: You dive at the boy, taking him off of his feet and leaving you both on the ground, with him underneath you. You can feel his skin against your own, and feel the terror in his breath. You launch a punch, and connect, hitting him in the face. You repeat this action a few times, before he pushes you off of him and onto the ground. He now climbs on top of you, pinning your arms with his legs, and punching you in the face. What do you do?
113111211211122.title: Tackle him!

1131112112111221.content: You are able to get your legs under the boy, and you kick him off. He falls back onto the ground, stunned. You might be able to attack, but you feel weak from the beating he gave you.
1131112112111221.title: Freedom!

11311121121112211.content: You clamber on top of the boy. Completely stunned, he is unable to resist, and you pin his arms down. You hit him a couple of times, and then you strangle him. He struggles, but you manage to hold on and soon he stops struggling. You keep hold until you are certain he is dead. The crowd goes wild, and the gate clanks open, letting you free.
11311121121112211.title: Success!

113111211211122111.content:
You head to the locker room, and the Lizard Alien greets you. He ushers for you to follow him, and leads you to teleporter. You arrive at another row of teleporters near a bank of screens. The alien appears in a separate teleporter a moment later.

"Watch this." The alien commands, pointing at a screen.

On it, you see the boy you fought stood naked in a dusty arena.

"This could have been you!" The alien enthuses, as a huge door clanks open on the side of the arena.

From the door, a huge reptilian creature, kind of like a dinosaur, storms out. It notices the now terrified boy, and charges. The boy falls over and screams, only to be picked up by the monster, thrown into the air and eaten. You see blood poor from the aliens mouth, but you don't get a great view of the action. The last thing you notice before the screen turns off is one of the boy's severed legs falling out of the creatures mouth.

"Now, you can't fight for a little while, so you are going to the planet for a bit." The lizard alien tells you. "Have fun!" He cackles as you are shoved into a teleporter.

You arrive in a bank of teleporters in what seems to be a small fortress. It is hot, and you can make out a dense rainforest around the fort. Some aliens patrol the perimiter, armed with laser and plasma rifles. You see several other kids, varying in age, size and equipment milling around camp-fires or making there way to and from the teleporters. You are embarrassed for a moment at your own lack of modesty, but see plenty of other humans who also lack clothing.

You see an older looking boy, probably about 12, standing around wearing a metal chest-piece over some tattered cotton clothes, and wonder if you should get some advice.
113111211211122111.title: Close Call

choices: Nod your head, and move on
1131112112111221111.content:
You approach the boy, and he turns to greet you. He is average height, but quite well built for his age, with short blond hair. He is holding a metal tipped spear that looks dangerously sharp. Before you can even ask for help, the boy starts talking.

"You're new, right? I can tell from your lack of weapons... or clothes." He says, smirking. You are embarrassed, but he continues. "This is the planet. The only place we can find and get new materials. You want food, weapons or armour? You have to get it down here. Or loot it in the arena."

He points at the jungle.

"As you can see, it is not a hospitable planet. You are safe inside forts like these, but outside, there are plenty of wild animals, dangerous environments and bandits. Generally, killing others on the planet is frowned upon, but it happens, and there are no rules against it. You can get out of here and try to get some equipment, or you can wait until they need you. If they need you, they send a small robot down to alert you. By the way, don't die down here. Unless you are a worthy opponent, you will be left dead for good. Too much effort to reach your corpse. Of course, lose up there too much and its goodbye as well. So its up to you. Leave and maybe die, but get an advantage, or stay, but get no advantage."
1131112112111221111.title: Help

11311121121112211111.content: You can leave the compound and try to find equipment, but if you die, you will stay dead, or you can stay here. You have no food, so you will be weak before your next match if you don't go. The environment is a dense jungle, and while there are teleporters leading to other climates, an alien turns you away. You have to stay in the jungle for a while. What do you do?
11311121121112211111.title: Choices

113111211211122111112.content: You head out into the jungle. You are unarmed and naked - not the best equipment. Fortunately, they have removed disease from this world, as it is no fun to watch a human die of illness. There are still plentiful dangers around though. You remember one of the aliens saying that sometimes loot is hidden in puzzle rooms, but if you lose the puzzle you will not have a good time. You see two places of interest in the distance: A small stone pyramid, about the size of a small bungalow, hidden in the forest and a wide, murky river. You could search the ruins and see if you can get loot, or try to fish.
113111211211122111112.title: Welcome to the jungle

1131112112111221111121.content: You quickly realise you are famished - equipment would be nice, but food is the priority. You head towards the river, arriving at a muddy bank amongst the foliage. The river seems fairly slow flowing, although you can't tell tge depth through the murky brownness of the water. You could try and find a sharp stick to fish, or wade in to test the waters.
1131112112111221111121.title: Go Fish

choices: Wade in slowly, checking your footing with each step
Walk in confidently - aliens might be watching, better impress them!
11311121121112211111212.content: You decide to check the waters before doing anything else. No point in fishing in a river that might be empty, right? How do you proceed?
11311121121112211111212.title: Go for a swim

113111211211122111112121.content: Taking it slow, you realise the river bottom is soft and treacherous. Finding firmer ground, you wade into the middle of the river. It goes up to the bottom of your ribs, and you can easily keep your balance in the slow water. In the murky depths below, you feel something brush against your leg. Before you can guess what it is, a sharp pain begins to spread across your lower body. You fall backwards, your legs quickly becoming unusable. In between agonised breaths, you catch sight of your assailants moving in for your now submerged upper body. Your screams are not heard above water, and the tiny, razor mouthed fish finish their grim work. Within a few seconds of noticing the creatures, you have been completely devoured. Chewing through you so fast you didn't even have time to react or try to escape, your flesh is entirely gone within 15 seconds of the first bite. Your flesh stripped skeleton washes up on the muddy beach, not even a scrap of skin clinging on. Anything that wasn't bone is now fish food. The most you can hope for now is that your naked skeleton will warn other gladiators to avoid wading in to the dangerous river.
113111211211122111112121.title: Wade in slowly, checking your footing with each...

113111211211122111112122.content: You stride into the river, although a few steps in you realise it is becoming difficult to walk. The thick mud at the bottom is sucking you down, and before you can try and step back, you are up to your shoulders. You scream as the water rises, but are cut off as the water covers your mouth. Your world plunges into darkness as you desperately struggle in the water, although you are firmly stuck. Eventually, your struggling ends, and you drown, hidden from site at the bottom of the river. Nobody will ever find your body to confirm it, but this is probably The End for you.
113111211211122111112122.title: A watery grave

1131112112111221111122.content:
Entering the pyramid, you find it is lit by some dim torches. In the small amount of light available to you, you make out a note written on paper.

"To the finder of this note: Here is your challenge. A weapon awaits you in the vault if you can beat three puzzles. They are dangerous and require good luck, skill and knowledge, in that order. To begin, pull a lever and hope..."

You see two levers attacked to the wall. This is the luck test. You will have to pull a lever and hope it is the correct one. Before you can turn around, a large stone door slams shut! You have to pick a lever now...
1131112112111221111122.title: Trap room

11311121121112211111221.content: You pull the lever, but nothing happens. Suddenly, the ceiling begins to slide open. You look up, and open your mouth to scream. Before you get the chance, a huge amount of sand and earth hidden in the ceiling pile down on top of you, burying you alive. You chose the wrong lever, and as you suffocate slowly, you realise this is The End.
11311121121112211111221.title: Sandtrap

11311121121112211111222.content: You pull the right lever, and with a click the wall slides open. It reveals a large chamber, with a huge pit in the floor, filled with sharp iron spikes. To reach the other side of the pit, you must jump across four small stone pillars. You see a camera in the corner of the room, televising your every move to an audience hoping you fall and die. What do you do?
11311121121112211111222.title: Skill puzzle

113111211211122111112221.content: You attempt to run and leap across the four pillars, but you barely clear the first one before you trip and fall headfirst into the pit. With your last breath, you see the rotting corpses and skeletons of several other children who were just as careless as you. Then your head lands on a spike, and your world goes black as your brain is pierced. The rest of your body follows a split-second later, and soon you are just a small corpse impaled on several iron spikes at the bottom of a pit. It is too late to reconsider your options, because as blood pours from the many holes in your body, this is the end
113111211211122111112221.title: Impaled...

113111211211122111112222.content:
You carefully progress over the pillars. You almost lose your balance a couple of times, but you successfully make it to the first pillar. From there, you tentatively leap from pillar to pillar, and finally do a large leap onto the final platform, pulling yourself up with your arms. You progress through a door into the last room.

The room is short and rectangular shaped. Inside, you see several nozzles in the wall. What will spew out of them should you fail is uncertain, although a charred, blackened skeleton lying on the ground in front of your, about the same size as you, suggests heat may be involved. You hope you don't end up that way.

On the wall is a riddle:

"At night they come without being fetched,
And by day they are lost without being stolen."

What is the answer?
113111211211122111112222.title: Take your time

1131112112111221111122221.content:
You panic as you realise you don't know the answer. You freeze, and fail to answer. After a ten second wait, the door behind you slams shut, and you hear a hissing noise inside the nozzles.

Before you can react, flames spew from them, filling the room. You are completely enveloped You barely manage to scream before your lungs are fried. Your flesh blackens, and you fall to your knees, cooked. The flames keep even after you stop living, and only when you are a charred skeleton do they stop. Your black burned bones fall to the ground, a warning to anyone else who comes of the price for failure. You are too charred to know it, but this is the end.
1131112112111221111122221.title: Crispy Kid

1131112112111221112.content:
Click here to skip!

http://www.writing.com/main/interact/ite...
1131112112111221112.title: Redirection centre!

choices: Try to shuffle out from under him with your legs
1131112112111222.content: You struggle to free your arms, but despite your opponents small size, you can't get them free. He continues hitting you, and your vision goes dark. You feel woozy - what do you do?
1131112112111222.title: Woozy

11311121121112221.content:
You keep trying to free your arm, but to no avail. Your vision goes black as the boy keeps beating you, terrified of execution should he lose. The last thing you hear is the crowd screaming with excitement, and the choking dust of the arena floor blocking your throat as you go unconscious, leaving you as an easy target for the boy to finish off.

You awake in the same chair as before, naked. This time, a different alien comes, and wordlessly leads you to a teleporter. You are moved to the locker room in a larger arena - even your death didn't warrant the grandest of the arenas - and the lizard alien leads you into the outside.

"I told you what would happen." The alien states, leading you to the centre of the oval field, which is roughly the size of a football field. "This will be fun, though! Well, not for you." He cackles as he retreats back to the locker room.
11311121121112221.title: TKO

113111211211122211.content:
You are left standing alone in the arena, unarmed and unclothed, completely defenceless. There is a large crowd, jeering at you as you stand there. The floor is made of dusty earth, and you can make out several bones lying around. Clearly, they don't resurrect those who die here. Suddenly, an alien voice booms out, and the crowd goes quiet. You figure our he is reading your details, and your sentence. As he finished, the crowd goes wild, which is probably not a good sign.

Suddenly, a large door opens on the side of the arena. A huge, reptilian creature, a little taller than a girraffe, but far more muscular and well built, stomps in. You can't help but be reminded of a dinosaur, what with its small, cold eyes and broad, flat mouth full of inward facing teeth. It has a narrow, stretchy underbelly for storing large prey, and runs on four large, clawed legs. And it is bearing down on you. Fast.
113111211211122211.title: Execution

1131112112111222111.content:
You barely have time to turn before the creature is upon you. It grabs you, flicking you into the air, before catching you in its mouth. Your terrified scream is cut short as the creature chews you, reducing you to a few gory chunks that used to be a boy. Your pieces are swallowed, visibly filling the creatures stretchy stomach. All the while, the crowd cheers manically, relishing in your brutal demise. The creature stalks back into the entryway, satisfied with its easy meal. What is left of you is passed a few days later by the huge creature along with the rest of its meals, and is unceremoniously burned. You are quickly forgotten, and leave the world without a single kill to your name, merely acting as entertainment for the bloodthirsty aliens and a tasty meal for a predator.

You are far too digested to know it, but this is certainly The End for you.
1131112112111222111.title: Lizard Food
